title: Drawing, "Landscape Near Guaranda, Ecuador", June 5, 1857
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache, on gray-green paper
markings:
Recto: Stamped in ink, at lower left: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union 
Verso: Stamped in ink, at ?: Cooper Union Museum New York
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper right: 2- Purplish light/ 3 - yellow/ 4 - green/ 5 - emerald green light/ 6 yerba; again, numbered and keyed to color code beyond hill on left: and again, at bottom right: Near Guaranda June 5th/57
description: Horizontal view into a sloping valley, includes a flowing river and a rising steep hill, with several houses visible in the left middle-ground near the riverbank; a rock, two seated figures, a third figures departs as another arrives in the central foreground; and a detail of the three figures in visible in the upper right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Landscape Near Guaranda, Ecuador", June 5, 1857.
June 5, 1857. Graphite, brush and white gouache, on gray-green paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-210.
